  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    toyJavaFxController()
    This constructor initializes the Menu class, assigns the arraylist containg the toys into toyList It also initializes the ToyStorageDb class and calls to load the data into an arraylist This also starts the program by calling the main menu.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    private void
    addNewToy(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method promts and adds a toy in the database It first asks the user to enter a serial number that serial number is validated and matched with the matching toy type then promts the user to enter the specific toy data related to the type finally, it calls a method from the ToyStorageDB class that gives all the type information into that method that adds it to the arraylist containing all toys
    private Integer
    ageValidation(String ageString)
    This method handles the exception in case the argument given for the age of the person is an invalid Integer if the argument given is less than or equals to 0, or it cannot be parsed, then it will return the maximum value an integer can be The max value is the default, meaning no filter will happen (no limitation).
    private String[]
    askAnimalData(String serialNum, String name, String brand, String price, String count, String age, String material)
    This method asks the user to input all related data to create a new animal toy object and stores it into a string to return
    private String[]
    askBoardGameData(String serialNum, String name, String brand, String price, String count, String age, String minPlayers, String maxPlayers, String designers)
    This method asks the user to input all related data to create a new boardgame object and stores it into a string to return
    private String[]
    askFigureData(String serialNum, String name, String brand, String price, String count, String age)
    This method asks the user to input all related data to create a new Figure object and stores it into a string to return
    private String[]
    askPuzzleData(String serialNum, String name, String brand, String price, String count, String age)
    This method asks the user to input all related data to create a new puzzle object and stores it into a string to return
    private void
    displayToy(Toy singleToy)
    This method displays a single of toys that matches the users search by calling the menu class to print

    (package private) void
    enableToy(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method is for enabling the other fields for the specific toy that the user selects to ensure that the right fields are correctly filled out
    private ArrayList<Toy>
    filterAge(ArrayList<Toy> createdToyList, Integer age)
    This method filters the toys by the minimum age requirement if the age of a person given equals to the requirement of toys, then it will add to the newToyList If the age of a person is a max value integer, that means there is no limitation and all toys in a given list will be added to the newToyList
    private ArrayList<Toy>
    filterPrice(ArrayList<Toy> createdToyList, Double minPrice, Double maxPrice)
    This method filters the toys by the price range that the user chooses
    private void
    findToysUsingSerialNumber()
    This method finds all toys with the users chosen toy Serial number to displays and allows the user to purchase the available toys
    private void
    findUsingName()
    This method finds all toys with the users chosen toy name and displays and allows the user to purchase the available toys
    private void
    findUsingType()
    This method finds all toys with the users chosen toy type and displays and allows the user to purchase the available toys
    private void
    giftSuggestion(String giftAge, String typeInput, String minPriceInput, String maxPriceInput)
    This method promts the user to enter details to filter through the toy data base It asks for age of the person recieving the gift, type of toy, and maximum and minimum price range of the toy at least one of the question must be answered for the filter to work A list of toys that was filtered is then displayed for the user to purchase
    private void
    initialize()
    This method initiallizes the javafx default and start up displays
    private Double
    maxPriceValidation(String maxPriceString)
    This method handles the exception in case the argument given for a maximum price of a toy is not a valid Double If the argument given is a valid double that is a 0 or a positive integer, it will return that number else it will prompt a notice or an error and always returns a max value (no limit).
    private Double
    minPriceValidation(String minPriceString)
    This method handles the exception in case the argument given for minimum price of a toy is not a valid Double If the argument given is a valid double that is a 0 or a positive integer, it will return that number.

  • Constructor Details

    • toyJavaFxController

      public toyJavaFxController()
      This constructor initializes the Menu class, assigns the arraylist containg the toys into toyList It also initializes the ToyStorageDb class and calls to load the data into an arraylist This also starts the program by calling the main menu.

  • Method Details

    • setupLogger

      private void setupLogger()
      This method sets up the logger by creating and opening the log files and setting the level

    • saveExit

      private void saveExit()
      This method displays indication of data saving as well as calls to transfer all toy data in the array list into the original text file

    • searchInventory

      private void searchInventory()
      This method calls for to prompt the sub menu for finding a specific toy that loops until the user chooses to exit back to the main menu It also checks if the backToMainMenu is True which returns back to the main menu before user input

    • findUsingType

      private void findUsingType()
      This method finds all toys with the users chosen toy type and displays and allows the user to purchase the available toys

    • addNewToy

      private void addNewToy(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method promts and adds a toy in the database It first asks the user to enter a serial number that serial number is validated and matched with the matching toy type then promts the user to enter the specific toy data related to the type finally, it calls a method from the ToyStorageDB class that gives all the type information into that method that adds it to the arraylist containing all toys

    • askBoardGameData

      private String[] askBoardGameData(String serialNum, String name, String brand, String price, String count, String age, String minPlayers, String maxPlayers, String designers) throws InvalidPlayersException
      This method asks the user to input all related data to create a new boardgame object and stores it into a string to return
      Parameters:
      serialNum - the serial number that the user wants for the boardgame
      Returns:
      an array with the data to create a boardgame
      Throws:
      InvalidPlayersException - when minplayer is more than maxplayer

    • askPuzzleData

      private String[] askPuzzleData(String serialNum, String name, String brand, String price, String count, String age)
      This method asks the user to input all related data to create a new puzzle object and stores it into a string to return
      Parameters:
      serialNum - the serial number that the user wants for the new Puzzle
      Returns:
      an array with the data to create a new puzzle toy

    • askAnimalData

      private String[] askAnimalData(String serialNum, String name, String brand, String price, String count, String age, String material)
      This method asks the user to input all related data to create a new animal toy object and stores it into a string to return
      Parameters:
      serialNum - the serial number that the user wants for the new Animal toy
      Returns:
      an array with the data to create a new animal toy

    • askFigureData

      private String[] askFigureData(String serialNum, String name, String brand, String price, String count, String age)
      This method asks the user to input all related data to create a new Figure object and stores it into a string to return
      Parameters:
      serialNum - the serial number that the user wants for the new Figure toy
      Returns:
      an array with the data to create a new Figure toy

    • removeToy

      private void removeToy(String serialNumber)
      this method promts and removes a toy from the database It first asks for a serial number then validates if that serial number matcher with any serial number in the database. The index of the matching toy with the same serial number is then located in the database and removes that object in that index

    • selectValidation

      private Toy selectValidation(ArrayList<Toy> searchedList)
      validates the user input when selecting an item to purchase The amount of items displayed is the maximum number that the user can enter and cannot enter a number that is bigger or less than the maximum number displayed
      Parameters:
      searchedList - the list of toys that shows when searching up an item
      userSelectionInput -
      Returns:
      the toy object that the user selected

    • purchase

      private void purchase(Toy toy)
      This method decrements the item that the user wants to purchase if there is at least one count of that object
      Parameters:
      toy - the toy that the user chooses to buy

    • displayToyList

      private void displayToyList(ArrayList<Toy> searchedList)
      This method displays the list of toys that matches the users search by calling the menu class to print
      Parameters:
      searchedList - the list containing the toys in the database as an ArrayList Class

    • displayToy

      private void displayToy(Toy singleToy)
      This method displays a single of toys that matches the users search by calling the menu class to print
      Parameters:
      singleToy - A single toy that will be displayed as a Toy class

    • giftSuggestion

      private void giftSuggestion(String giftAge, String typeInput, String minPriceInput, String maxPriceInput)
      This method promts the user to enter details to filter through the toy data base It asks for age of the person recieving the gift, type of toy, and maximum and minimum price range of the toy at least one of the question must be answered for the filter to work A list of toys that was filtered is then displayed for the user to purchase

    • filterPrice

      private ArrayList<Toy> filterPrice(ArrayList<Toy> createdToyList, Double minPrice, Double maxPrice)
      This method filters the toys by the price range that the user chooses
      Parameters:
      createdToyList - createdToyList this is a list containing toys that have reacently been filtered, to further filter it
      minPrice - the lowest price the person is willing to buy (should not be less than 0)
      maxPrice - the highest price the person is willing to buy (should not be less than minPrice)
      Returns:
      a new list containing the filtered toys by price range

    • filterAge

      private ArrayList<Toy> filterAge(ArrayList<Toy> createdToyList, Integer age)
      This method filters the toys by the minimum age requirement if the age of a person given equals to the requirement of toys, then it will add to the newToyList If the age of a person is a max value integer, that means there is no limitation and all toys in a given list will be added to the newToyList
      Parameters:
      createdToyList - this is a list containing toys that have reacently been filtered, to further filter it
      age - the age of the person receiving the gift
      Returns:
      a new list containing the filtered toys that is allowed to be played by the given age of a person

    • ageValidation

      private Integer ageValidation(String ageString)
      This method handles the exception in case the argument given for the age of the person is an invalid Integer if the argument given is less than or equals to 0, or it cannot be parsed, then it will return the maximum value an integer can be The max value is the default, meaning no filter will happen (no limitation). Else set the age to the argument given
      Parameters:
      ageString - the user input for the age of the age of a person
      Returns:
      the argument or if invalid a max value of integer (default)

    • minPriceValidation

      private Double minPriceValidation(String minPriceString)
      This method handles the exception in case the argument given for minimum price of a toy is not a valid Double If the argument given is a valid double that is a 0 or a positive integer, it will return that number. It will prompt a notice or an error and always returns a 0.0 in this case.
      Parameters:
      minPriceString - the user input for the minimum price to filter. Can be left blank
      Returns:
      the minimum value for filtering price that the user chose or 0 if invalid input by user

    • maxPriceValidation

      private Double maxPriceValidation(String maxPriceString)
      This method handles the exception in case the argument given for a maximum price of a toy is not a valid Double If the argument given is a valid double that is a 0 or a positive integer, it will return that number else it will prompt a notice or an error and always returns a max value (no limit).
      Parameters:
      maxPriceString - the user input for the maximum price to filter. Can be left blank
      Returns:
      the maximum value a double can be if invalid or a value at or above 0 that the user chose if valid

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      This method initiallizes the javafx default and start up displays

    • submitGift

      void submitGift(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method submits the gifts by calling giftsuggetion to display
      Parameters:
      event - the button to submit

    • purchaseThis

      void purchaseThis(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method purchases the selected item
      Parameters:
      event - the button to purchase

    • onSearchHome

      private void onSearchHome(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the Search button on the Home tab. This method reuses the same logic as the console program: - If "Serial Number" is selected, it searches using compareSNToAllToys. - If "Name" is selected, it searches using compareNameToAllToys. - If "Type" is selected, it converts F/A/P/B to the full type and searches using compareTypeToAllToys. The results are stored in homeSearchList and displayed in the Home tab list view as strings from Toy.toString().
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent generated by clicking the Search button

    • onClearHome

      private void onClearHome(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the Clear button on the Home tab. This method clears the three search text fields and repopulates the Home list view with the full toy list from toyList.
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent generated by clicking the Clear button

    • onBuy

      private void onBuy(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the Buy button on the Home tab. This method: - Gets the selected row in the Home list view - Uses homeSearchList to find the matching Toy object - Calls the existing purchase(Toy) method - Saves the data back to the file using toyStorageDB.saveData() - Refreshes the Home list view to reflect updated counts
      Parameters:
      event - the ActionEvent generated by clicking the Buy button

    • searchRemove

      private void searchRemove(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      this method seerches for the item that the user wants to remove
      Parameters:
      event - the button that searches

    • submitRemove

      private void submitRemove(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method actually removes the selected toy from the databaase
      Parameters:
      event - the button to remove the toy

    • enableToy

      void enableToy(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method is for enabling the other fields for the specific toy that the user selects to ensure that the right fields are correctly filled out
      Parameters:
      event - the combobox that has the toy category
